IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: This is the planned power cut that was previously scheduled for last year but was cancelled on the day due to access issues. To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a piece of equipment called a transformer that needs replacing and upgrading. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off for a short period over 2 days to upgrade the transformer. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place near Rabans Lane.

We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place on Finningham Road.

Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 07-FEB-2026 11:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 23:23 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers made partial repairs on the underground network in the Hastings TN35 4 area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 2 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Bev at 23:04 - As it's that time of night where most of our customers are going to sleep, we wanted to let you know that we will continue to send text messages throughout the night with progress updates. If you want to continue receiving updates but prefer not to be disturbed, you can place your phone on silent or activate the Do Not Disturb settings on smart phones. If you no longer want to receive updates, you will need to visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Thank you
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 14:05 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers investigated the cause of the power cut in the Vale Road area. We can now confirm that the issue is a fault on our underground electricity cabling and there are 3 properties affected, which we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Will at 13:05 - Thanks for bearing with us over today, I just wanted to give you the latest from our engineers. Our staff have now confirmed that our substation equipment has operated due to an underground cable fault which we'll need to pinpoint, excavate and repair. We're sending specialist teams and equipment to site, and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. For more information about this type of fault; here's a short video https://bit.ly/2ScxQDZ - I'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 12:33 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Hi, Bev here - I just wanted to introduce myself, and let you know that I'll be here through the night to keep you updated with news from our staff as they work to get your lights back on.

In order to provide you the clearest information, my team and I write our updates in real time. Because of this, I apologise in advance if I make any mistakes with spelling or grammar; we're only human!

I know that it's dark and that will be especially worrying, but both our field teams and our contact centre work 24 hours a day, so for now, I hope you're doing okay and I'll let you know as soon as we have some more news.

Sent by Bev at 01:50 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers made partial repairs on the overhead network in the Norwich NR9 5/NR20 3 area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Bev at 01:23

Sent by Bev at 00:25 - Thanks for your patience over tonight.

Our engineers have let us know that they have located a large tree branch that has fallen onto and damaged some of our overhead cabling. A specialist team are on the way and to give them time to make the repairs safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 03:30 and 04:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 09:03 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that we are currently in the process of locating the fault on the overhead network, so that can carry out repairs. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 11:30 and 12:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Lisa at 08:04 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 24 properties still affected by the overhead network fault, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 130 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 05:53. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message:
Our engineers are awaiting the arrival of our generator.

Although this will be temporary, engineers will still need to repair the issue before it can be removed and network power is resumed. Depending on the fault, it may take several days for our engineers to pinpoint the problem and plan in the work. The temporary generator will remain on site to provide power until we can locate the issue and restore the network back to normal running conditions.

If you'd like any further information, our team are always here to help. Sent by Talie at 09:29.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 08:35 - Our engineers have completed their investigations.

There's going to be a lot of work required to repair the issue safely, so we have decided to use a temporary generator to provide power. To allow time for us to get the generator out to your area and connect it, we're now estimating we'll have power back on between 12:00 and 13:00.

We're sorry to change the time frame and will let you know when it arrives.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 08:17 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our underground cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Our engineers are dealing with this, but we are sorry we can't give you a time for the restoration of supply at present.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Talbot Road area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to be testing if the network is still healthy.

They will start at the substation, and often apply specialist equipment that may turn your power back on for a brief period, so don't worry if your power comes on and goes off again. They will also check smaller sites which run along our cabling route, these break our network down into smaller sections and can help pinpoint any possible problems.

Our estimated time frame of 11:30 - 12:30 hasn't changed, so I'll let you know more once our staff update us. Sent by Luke at 09:13.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Luke at 08:44 - Our staff are on the way to the Talbot Road area as our safety equipment within the nearby substation has operated.

We believe a developing cable fault is causing these repeat power cuts, so while our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 11:30 and 12:30, it's possible this may need to change once staff have assessed. This is because every power cut increases the chance of the fault has developing to a point that our specialist teams can pinpoint it using specialist equipment. I'll let you know once our teams arrive.
